Type.Name: TextIter

TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit TextIter extends System.ValueType implements class System.IEquatable`1<valuetype Gtk.TextIter>

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: Text buffer iterator

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardChar() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves the iterator back one character
Docs.returns: true if the operation succeeded
Docs.remarks: Returns if movement was possible; if iter was the first in the buffer (character offset 0), this returns for convenience when writing loops.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardChars(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: number of characters to move backwards.
Docs.summary: Moves the iterator back a number of characters.
Docs.returns: true if the operation succeeded
Docs.remarks: Moves count characters backward, if possible (if count would move past the start or end of the buffer, moves to the start or end of the buffer). The return value indicates whether the iterator moved onto a dereferenceable position; if the iterator didn't move, or moved onto the end iterator, then is returned. If count is 0, the function does nothing and returns .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardCursorPosition() cil managed

Docs.summary: Like , but moves backward.
Docs.returns: if we moved

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardCursorPositions(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves back cursor positions.
Docs.returns: if we moved and the new position is dereferenceable

MemberSignature.Value: public bool BackwardFindChar (Gtk.TextCharPredicate pred, Gtk.TextIter limit);
.method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardFindChar(class Gtk.TextCharPredicate pred, valuetype Gtk.TextIter limit) cil managed

Docs.param: A to call on each character.
Docs.summary: Same as , but goes backward from iter.
Docs.returns: whether a match was found

MemberSignature.Value: public bool BackwardFindChar (Gtk.TextCharPredicate pred, IntPtr user_data, Gtk.TextIter limit);
.method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardFindChar(class Gtk.TextCharPredicate pred, native int user_data, valuetype Gtk.TextIter limit) cil managed

Docs.param: A to call on each character.
Docs.summary: Obsolete. Replaced by .
Docs.returns: whether a match was found

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardLine() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves the iterator backward one line
Docs.returns: true if the operation succeeded.
Docs.remarks: Returns if iter could be moved; i.e. if iter was at character offset 0, this function returns . Therefore if iter was already on line 0, but not at the start of the line, iter is snapped to the start of the line and the function returns . (Note that this implies that in a loop calling this function, the line number may not change on every iteration, if your first iteration is on line 0.)

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardLines(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: number of lines to move backwards.
Docs.summary: Moves the iterator back a number of lines.
Docs.returns: true if the operation succeeded.
Docs.remarks: Moves count lines backward, if possible (if count would move past the start or end of the buffer, moves to the start or end of the buffer). The return value indicates whether the iterator moved onto a dereferenceable position; if the iterator didn't move, or moved onto the end iterator, then is returned. If count is 0, the function does nothing and returns . If count is negative, moves forward by 0 - count lines.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool BackwardSearch (string str, Gtk.TextSearchFlags flags, out Gtk.TextIter match_start, out Gtk.TextIter match_end, Gtk.TextIter limit);

.method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardSearch(string str, valuetype Gtk.TextSearchFlags flags, valuetype Gtk.TextIter match_start, valuetype Gtk.TextIter match_end, valuetype Gtk.TextIter limit) cil managed

Docs.param: bitmask of flags affecting the search
return location for start of match, or
return location for end of match, or
location of last possible match_start, or for start of buffer
Docs.summary: Same as , but moves backward.
Docs.returns: whether a match was found

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardSentenceStart() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves backward to the previous sentence start; if iter is already at the start of a sentence, moves backward to the next one.
Docs.returns: if iter moved and is not the end iterator
Docs.remarks: Sentence boundaries are determined by Pango and should be correct for nearly any language (if not, the correct fix would be to the Pango text boundary algorithms).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardSentenceStarts(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.summary: Calls up to times, or until it returns .
Docs.returns: if iter moved and is not the end iterator
Docs.remarks: If is negative, moves forward instead of backward.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardToTagToggle(class Gtk.TextTag tag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves backward to the next toggle (on or off) of the tag, or to the next toggle of any tag if tag is .
Docs.returns: whether we found a tag toggle before iter
Docs.remarks: If no matching tag toggles are found, returns , otherwise . Does not return toggles located at iter, only toggles before iter. Sets iter to the location of the toggle, or the start of the buffer if no toggle is found.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardVisibleCursorPosition() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves the iterator back to the previous visible cursor position.
Docs.returns: a , true if the iter moved and the new position is dereferenceable
Docs.remarks: See for details.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardVisibleCursorPositions(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves backward up to visible cursor positions.
Docs.returns: a , true if the cursor was moved and is in a dereferenceable position.
Docs.remarks: See for details.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardVisibleLine() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves to the beginning of the previous visible line.
Docs.returns: if the iter could be moved.
Docs.remarks: Moves to the start of the previous visible line. If iter was at character offset 0, this function returns . If iter was already on line 0, but not at the start of the line, iter is snapped to the start of the line and the function returns . (Note that this implies that in a loop calling this function, the line number may not change on every iteration, if your first iteration is on line 0.).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardVisibleLines(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: The number of lines to move.
Docs.summary: Moves backward by a specified number of visible lines.
Docs.returns: if the result of the move is a referenceable position.
Docs.remarks: If would move past the start or end of the buffer, the iter is moved to the start or end of the buffer. The return value indicates whether the iterator moved onto a dereferenceable position. If the iterator didn't move, or moved onto the end iterator, then is returned. If count is 0, the function does nothing and returns . If count is negative, the iter is moved forward by 0 - count lines.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardVisibleWordStart() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves backward to the previous visible word start. (If the iterator is currently on a word start, moves backward to the next one after that.)
Docs.returns: a
Docs.remarks: Word breaks are determined by Pango and should be correct for nearly any language (if not, the correct fix would be to the Pango word break algorithms).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardVisibleWordStarts(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.summary: Calls up to times.
Docs.returns: a , true if the iterator moved and is not at the end of the text.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardWordStart() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves backward to the previous word start.
Docs.returns: if iter moved and is not the end iterator
Docs.remarks: (If iter is currently on a word start, moves backward to the next one after that.) Word breaks are determined by Pango and should be correct for nearly any language (if not, the correct fix would be to the Pango word break algorithms).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BackwardWordStarts(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.summary: Calls up to times.
Docs.returns: if iter moved and is not the end iterator

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool BeginsTag(class Gtk.TextTag tag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns if tag is toggled on at exactly this point.
Docs.returns: whether iter is the start of a range tagged with tag
Docs.remarks: If tag is , returns if any tag is toggled on at this point. Note that the returns if iter is the start of the tagged range; tells you whether an iterator is within a tagged range.

Docs.summary: Obtains the buffer the iter is in
Returns the number of bytes in the line containing iter, including the paragraph delimiters.
Docs.value: number of bytes in the line

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool CanInsert(bool default_editability) cil managed

Docs.param: if text is editable by default
Docs.summary: Considering the default editability of the buffer, and tags that affect editability, determines whether text inserted at iter would be editable.
Docs.returns: whether text inserted at iter would be editable
Docs.remarks: If text inserted at iter would be editable then the user should be allowed to insert text at iter. uses this function to decide whether insertions are allowed at a given position.

Docs.summary: Character the TextIter points to.
Docs.value: a 1 character length string container the character pointed to by the TextIter
Docs.remarks: Even though this property returns a string, it will never hold more than a single character.

Docs.summary: Number of characters in the TextIter's line.
Docs.value: Returns the number of characters in the TextIter's current line, including the paragraph delimiters.
Docs.remarks: None.

Docs.summary: If the location at iter contains a child anchor, the anchor is returned. Otherwise, is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 Compare(valuetype Gtk.TextIter rhs) cil managed

Docs.summary: A qsort()-style function that returns negative if lhs is less than rhs, positive if lhs is greater than rhs, and 0 if they are equal.
Docs.returns: -1 if lhs is less than rhs, 1 if lhs is greater, 0 if they are equal
Docs.remarks: Ordering is in character offset order, i.e. the first character in the buffer is less than the second character in the buffer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance valuetype Gtk.TextIter Copy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a dynamically-allocated copy of an iterator.
Docs.returns: a

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Editable(bool default_setting) cil managed

Docs.param: if text is editable by default
Docs.summary: Returns whether the character at iter is within an editable region of text.
Docs.returns: whether iter is inside an editable range

remarks.para: Non-editable text is "locked" and cannot be changed by the user via . This function is simply a convenience wrapper around . If no tags applied to this text effect editability, will be returned.

You do not want to use this function to decide whether text can be inserted at iter, because for insertion you do not want to know whether the char at iter is inside an editable range, you want to know whether a new character inserted at iter would be inside an editable range. Use to handle this case.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool EndsLine() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns true if the iterator is at the end of a line.
Docs.returns: true if the iterator is at the end of a line.
Docs.remarks: Returns if iter points to the start of the paragraph delimiter characters for a line (delimiters will be either a newline, a carriage return, a carriage return followed by a newline, or a Unicode paragraph separator character). Note that an iterator pointing to the \n of a \r\n pair will not be counted as the end of a line, the line ends before the \r. The end iterator is considered to be at the end of a line, even though there are no paragraph delimiter chars there.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool EndsSentence() cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether iter ends a sentence.
Docs.returns: if iter is at the end of a sentence.
Docs.remarks: Sentence boundaries are determined by Pango and should be correct for nearly any language (if not, the correct fix would be to the Pango text boundary algorithms).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool EndsTag(class Gtk.TextTag tag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns if tag is toggled off at exactly this point.
Docs.returns: whether iter is the end of a range tagged with tag
Docs.remarks: If tag is , returns if any tag is toggled off at this point. Note that the returns if iter is the end of the tagged range; tells you whether an iterator is within a tagged range.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool EndsWord() cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether iter ends a natural-language word.
Docs.returns: if iter is at the end of a word
Docs.remarks: Word breaks are determined by Pango and should be correct for nearly any language (if not, the correct fix would be to the Pango word break algorithms).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardChar() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves this iterator forward by one character offset.
Docs.returns: A boolean: if the iterator moved and is dereferenceable.
Docs.remarks: Note that images embedded in the buffer occupy 1 character slot, so this may actually move onto an image instead of a character, if you have images in your buffer. If this object is the end iterator or one character before it, the object will now point at the end iterator, and return for convenience when writing loops.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardChars(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: number of characters to move, may be negative
Docs.summary: Moves count characters if possible (if count would move past the start or end of the buffer, moves to the start or end of the buffer).
Docs.returns: whether iter moved and is dereferenceable
Docs.remarks: The return value indicates whether the new position of iter is different from its original position, and dereferenceable (the last iterator in the buffer is not dereferenceable). If count is 0, the function does nothing and returns .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardCursorPosition() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves iter forward by a single cursor position.
Docs.returns: if we moved and the new position is dereferenceable
Docs.remarks: Cursor positions are (unsurprisingly) positions where the cursor can appear. Perhaps surprisingly, there may not be a cursor position between all characters. The most common example for European languages would be a carriage return/newline sequence. For some Unicode characters, the equivalent of say the letter "a" with an accent mark will be represented as two characters, first the letter then a "combining mark" that causes the accent to be rendered; so the cursor cannot go between those two characters.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardCursorPositions(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves up cursor positions.
Docs.returns: if we moved and the new position is dereferenceable
Docs.remarks: See for details.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool ForwardFindChar (Gtk.TextCharPredicate pred, Gtk.TextIter limit);
.method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardFindChar(class Gtk.TextCharPredicate pred, valuetype Gtk.TextIter limit) cil managed

Docs.param: A to call on each character.
Docs.summary: Advances the iterator, calling on each character.
Docs.returns: whether a match was found
Docs.remarks: If pred returns , returns and stops scanning. If pred never returns , iter is set to limit if limit is non-, otherwise to the end iterator.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool ForwardFindChar (Gtk.TextCharPredicate pred, IntPtr user_data, Gtk.TextIter limit);

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardLine() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves iter to the start of the next line.
Docs.returns: A boolean; whether the iterator is dereferenceable
Docs.remarks: Returns if there was a next line to move to, and if iter was simply moved to the end of the buffer and is now not dereferenceable, or if iter was already at the end of the buffer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardLines(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: number of lines to move forward
Docs.summary: Moves count lines forward, if possible (if count would move past the start or end of the buffer, moves to the start or end of the buffer).
Docs.returns: whether iter moved and is dereferenceable
Docs.remarks: The return value indicates whether the iterator moved onto a dereferenceable position; if the iterator didn't move, or moved onto the end iterator, then is returned. If count is 0, the function does nothing and returns . If count is negative, moves backward by 0 - count lines.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool ForwardSearch (string str, Gtk.TextSearchFlags flags, out Gtk.TextIter match_start, out Gtk.TextIter match_end, Gtk.TextIter limit);

.method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardSearch(string str, valuetype Gtk.TextSearchFlags flags, valuetype Gtk.TextIter match_start, valuetype Gtk.TextIter match_end, valuetype Gtk.TextIter limit) cil managed

Docs.param: flags affecting how the search is done
return location for start of match, or
return location for end of match, or
bound for the search, or for the end of the buffer
Docs.summary: Searches forward for .
Docs.returns: whether a match was found

remarks.para: Any match is returned by setting to the first character of the match and to the first character after the match. The search will not continue past limit. Note that a search is a linear or O(n) operation, so you may wish to use limit to avoid locking up your UI on large buffers.

If the GTK_TEXT_SEARCH_VISIBLE_ONLY flag is present, the match may have invisible text interspersed in str. i.e. str will be a possibly-noncontiguous subsequence of the matched range. similarly, if you specify GTK_TEXT_SEARCH_TEXT_ONLY, the match may have pixbufs or child widgets mixed inside the matched range. If these flags are not given, the match must be exact; the special 0xFFFC character in str will match embedded pixbufs or child widgets.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardSentenceEnd() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves forward to the next sentence end.
Docs.returns: if iter moved and is not the end iterator
Docs.remarks: If iter is at the end of a sentence, moves to the next end of sentence. Sentence boundaries are determined by Pango and should be correct for nearly any language (if not, the correct fix would be to the Pango text boundary algorithms).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardSentenceEnds(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.summary: Calls times (or until it returns ).
Docs.returns: if iter moved and is not the end iterator
Docs.remarks: If is negative, moves backward instead of forward.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void ForwardToEnd() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves iter forward to the "end iterator," which points one past the last valid character in the buffer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardToLineEnd() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves the iterator to point to the paragraph delimiter characters, which will be either a newline, a carriage return, a carriage return/newline in sequence, or the Unicode paragraph separator character.
Docs.returns: if we moved and the new location is not the end iterator
Docs.remarks: If the iterator is already at the paragraph delimiter characters, moves to the paragraph delimiter characters for the next line. If iter is on the last line in the buffer, which does not end in paragraph delimiters, moves to the end iterator (end of the last line), and returns .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardToTagToggle(class Gtk.TextTag tag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves forward to the next toggle (on or off) of the tag, or to the next toggle of any tag if tag is .
Docs.returns: whether we found a tag toggle after iter
Docs.remarks: If no matching tag toggles are found, returns , otherwise . Does not return toggles located at iter, only toggles after iter. Sets iter to the location of the toggle, or to the end of the buffer if no toggle is found.

Docs.summary: Moves the iterator forward to the next visible cursor position.

Docs.summary: Moves up to visible cursor positions.

Docs.remarks: See for details.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardVisibleLine() cil managed

Docs.summary: Moves to the start of the next visible line.
Docs.returns: if the iter could be moved and is dereferenceable after the move.
Docs.remarks: . Returns if there was a next line to move to, and if the iter was moved to the end of the buffer and is now not dereferenceable, or if the iter was already at the end of the buffer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ForwardVisibleLines(int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: The number of lines to move.
Docs.summary: Moves forward by a specified number of visible lines.
Docs.returns: if the iter could be moved and is dereferenceable after the move.
Docs.remarks: If would move past the start or end of the buffer, the iter is moved to the start or end of the buffer. The return value indicates whether the iterator moved onto a dereferenceable position. If the iterator didn't move, or moved onto the end iterator, then is returned. If count is 0, the function does nothing and returns . If count is negative, the iter is moved backward by 0 - count lines.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool GetAttributes(class Gtk.TextAttributes values) cil managed

Docs.summary: Computes the effect of any tags applied to this spot in the text.
Docs.returns: if values was modified

remarks.para: The values parameter should be initialized to the default settings you wish to use if no tags are in effect. You would typically obtain the defaults from .
will modify values, applying the effects of any tags present at iter. If any tags affected values, the function returns .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: To be added.
Docs.returns: To be added.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string GetSlice(valuetype Gtk.TextIter end) cil managed

Docs.param: iterator at end of a range
Docs.summary: Returns the text in the given range.
Docs.returns: slice of text from the buffer
Docs.remarks: A "slice" is an array of characters encoded in UTF-8 format, including the Unicode "unknown" character 0xFFFC for iterable non-character elements in the buffer, such as images. Because images are encoded in the slice, byte and character offsets in the returned array will correspond to byte offsets in the text buffer. Note that 0xFFFC can occur in normal text as well, so it is not a reliable indicator that a pixbuf or widget is in the buffer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string GetText(valuetype Gtk.TextIter end) cil managed

Docs.param: iterator at end of a range
Docs.summary: Returns text in the given range.
Docs.returns: the string from the buffer
Docs.remarks: If the range contains non-text elements such as images, the character and byte offsets in the returned string will not correspond to character and byte offsets in the buffer. If you want offsets to correspond, see .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Gtk.TextTag[] GetToggledTags(bool toggled_on) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array of that are toggled on or off at this point.
Docs.returns: tags toggled at this point
Docs.remarks: (If toggled_on is , the list contains tags that are toggled on.) If a tag is toggled on at iter, then some non-empty range of characters following iter has that tag applied to it. If a tag is toggled off, then some non-empty range following iter does not have the tag applied to it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string GetVisibleSlice(valuetype Gtk.TextIter end) cil managed

Docs.summary: Like , but invisible text is not included.
Docs.returns: slice of text from the buffer
Docs.remarks: Invisible text is usually invisible because a with the "invisible" attribute turned on has been applied to it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string GetVisibleText(valuetype Gtk.TextIter end) cil managed

Docs.summary: Like , but invisible text is not included.
Docs.returns: string containing visible text in the range
Docs.remarks: Invisible text is usually invisible because a with the "invisible" attribute turned on has been applied to it.

Docs.summary: GType Property.
Docs.remarks: Returns the native value for .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool HasTag(class Gtk.TextTag tag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns if iter is within a range tagged with tag.
Docs.returns: whether iter is tagged with tag

Docs.returns: if iter is in the range
Docs.remarks: and must be in ascending order.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool InsideSentence() cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether iter is inside a sentence (as opposed to in between two sentences, e.g. after a period and before the first letter of the next sentence).
Docs.returns: if iter is inside a sentence.
Docs.remarks: Sentence boundaries are determined by Pango and should be correct for nearly any language (if not, the correct fix would be to the Pango text boundary algorithms).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool InsideWord() cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether iter is inside a natural-language word (as opposed to say inside some whitespace).
Docs.returns: if iter is inside a word
Docs.remarks: Word breaks are determined by Pango and should be correct for nearly any language (if not, the correct fix would be to the Pango word break algorithms).

Docs.summary: returns true if the iter is at the caret
Docs.remarks: returns true if this iterator equals the iterator returned by

Docs.summary: Returns true if the iterator is at the end of the parent
Docs.value: true if the iterator is equal to Buffer.EndIter
Docs.remarks: The most efficient way to check whether an iterator is the end iterator.

Docs.summary: Returns if iter is the first iterator in the buffer, that is if iter has a character offset of 0.
Docs.value: whether iter is the first in the buffer

Docs.summary: A convenience wrapper around , which returns the language in effect at iter.
Docs.remarks: If no tags affecting language apply to iter, the return value is identical to that of .

Docs.summary: Line number the iterator is currently on.
Docs.value: The line number the iterator is currently on.
Docs.remarks: Lines in a are numbered beginning with 0 for the first line in the buffer.

Docs.summary: Returns the byte index of the iterator, counting from the start of a newline-terminated line.
Docs.value: distance from start of line, in bytes
Docs.remarks: Remember that encodes text in UTF-8, and that characters can require a variable number of bytes to represent.

Docs.summary: Returns the character offset of the iterator, counting from the start of a newline-terminated line.
Docs.remarks: The first character on the line has offset 0.

Docs.summary: Returns an array of at this location.
Docs.remarks: Because marks are not iterable (they do not take up any "space" in the buffer, they are just marks in between iterable locations), multiple marks can exist in the same place. The returned list is not in any meaningful order.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig valuetype Gtk.TextIter New(native int raw) cil managed

Docs.summary: Internal method
Docs.returns: a new
Docs.remarks: This is an internal method and should not be used by user code.

Docs.summary: Manipulates the offset from the start of the buffer.
Docs.value: Returns the offset of the iter from the start of the buffer.
Docs.remarks: None.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig specialname valuetype Gtk.TextIter op_Explicit(valuetype GLib.Value val) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts from a native GValue.
Docs.returns: a TextIter.
Docs.remarks: Internal. Provided for bindings.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig specialname valuetype GLib.Value op_Explicit(valuetype Gtk.TextIter boxed) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts to a native GValue.
Docs.returns: a native GValue.
Docs.remarks: Internal. Provided for bindings.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Order(valuetype Gtk.TextIter second) cil managed

Docs.summary: Swaps the value of first and second if second comes before first in the buffer.
Docs.remarks: That is, ensures that first and second are in sequence. Most text buffer functions that take a range call this automatically on your behalf, so there's no real reason to call it yourself in those cases. There are some exceptions, such as , that expect a pre-sorted range.

Docs.summary: return the pixbuf at this iter, if it is one.
Docs.remarks: If the element at iter is a , the Pixbuf is returned. Otherwise, is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool StartsLine() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns if iter begins a paragraph.
Docs.returns: whether iter begins a line

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool StartsSentence() cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether iter begins a sentence.
Docs.returns: if iter is at the start of a sentence.
Docs.remarks: Sentence boundaries are determined by Pango and should be correct for nearly any language (if not, the correct fix would be to the Pango text boundary algorithms).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool StartsWord() cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether iter begins a natural-language word.
Docs.returns: if iter is at the start of a word
Docs.remarks: Word breaks are determined by Pango and should be correct for nearly any language (if not, the correct fix would be to the Pango word break algorithms).

Docs.summary: Returns an array of tags that apply to iter, in ascending order of priority (highest-priority tags are last).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool TogglesTag(class Gtk.TextTag tag) cil managed

Docs.summary: whether tag is either toggled on or off at iter
Docs.returns: whether tag is toggled on or off at iter

Docs.summary: Returns the number of bytes from the start of the line to the given iter, not counting bytes that are invisible due to tags with the "invisible" flag toggled on.
Docs.value: byte index of iter with respect to the start of the line

Docs.summary: Returns the offset in characters from the start of the line to the given iter, not counting characters that are invisible due to tags with the "invisible" flag toggled on.
Docs.value: offset in visible characters from the start of the line

Docs.summary: Returns an empty
